definition: To compel or force someone to do something against their will, often implying a sense of coercion or pressure. It is commonly used to describe situations where someone is being made to perform an action or behave in a certain way, even if they do not want to.

examples.german: Ich zwinge dich, es zu tun.
examples.english: I force you to do it.

examples.german: Er wurde gezwungen, seine Meinung zu 채ndern.
examples.english: He was forced to change his opinion.

examples.english: They compelled him to return the money.

examples.english: The teacher made the students be quiet.

examples.english: They were forced to give up their plans.
